medical_history.chief_complaint: Necrotizing fasciitis following a human bite on the leg.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was bitten on her left calf the day before presentation, leading to a 24-hour delay before emergency room admission. Initial symptoms included a bite mark and fever (38.3 Â°C). The patient experienced rapid deterioration, requiring emergency intubation within hours. During the first hour in the emergency room, burned appearance of the skin around the bite was noted, and surgical intervention was required for necrotizing fasciitis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Moderately obese, history of marijuana and tobacco use. No previous equivalent medical history was stated.
medical_history.social_history: Returned from a trip to Bamako, Mali before presentation.
